meanings.definition: A loop with a running knot, tightening as the rope or wire is pulled and typically used to hang people or trap animals.
meanings.sent1: The hunter set up nooses to catch rabbits in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The nooses were carefully crafted to ensnare any unsuspecting prey.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got caught in one of the nooses and had quite the adventure swinging around.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like invisible nooses, tightening around his heart with each lie.
meanings.sent5: The nooses swayed ominously in the wind, a silent threat to any who dared to approach.

meanings.definition: To make a noose or lasso of.
meanings.sent1: He learned how to noose a rope quickly during the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: She deftly nooses the end of the lasso to catch the runaway calf.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to noose the audience's attention with his dazzling tricks.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to noose her thoughts, pulling them in a direction she didn't want to go.
meanings.sent5: She nooses the thread around the needle, ready to start sewing the torn fabric.

meanings.sent1: The cowboy always preferred to noose his belongings to keep them safe on the trail.
meanings.sent2: She carefully nooses the knot to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten managed to noose the toy mouse to its paw, thinking it caught real prey.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was noosed with worry, unable to escape the tight grip of fear.
meanings.sent5: The noosed rope held firm, preventing the gate from swinging open in the strong wind.
